alert.note: Alert for St. Marys (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued April 27 at 11:18AM EDT until April 29 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Up to one foot of inundation above ground level possible in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. * WHERE...Shoreline in St. Marys County. * WHEN...From Friday evening through Saturday afternoon, especially around the time of high tide. * IMPACTS...At 3.5 feet, water covers roads on Saint George Island, is in yards, and is approaching structures. To the east, inundation is occurring at multiple marinas off St. Mary`s River, Smith Creek, and Jutland Creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tides two to two and a half feet above normal. The next high tide at Piney Point is at 9:24 PM and 9:24 AM. The next high tide at Coltons Point is at 10:00 PM and 10:00 AM. The next high tide at Point Lookout is at 8:09 PM and 8:39 AM. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. St Marys River at Straits Point MLLW Categories - Minor 3.0 ft, Moderate 3.5 ft, Major 5.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.4 ft, Moderate 1.9 ft, Major 3.4 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 27/08 AM 2.7 1.1 1.3 1.0 None 27/10 PM 2.7 1.1 1.4 1.0 None 28/08 AM 2.7 1.1 1.4 2.0 None 28/10 PM 3.6 2.0 2.2 2.0 Moderate 29/09 AM 3.6 2.0 2.3 1.0 Moderate 29/10 PM 3.1 1.5 1.7 1.0 Minor &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
